meanings.definition: A separate printing of an article or chapter that originally appeared as part of a larger publication.
meanings.sent1: I requested an offprint of the interesting article from the magazine.
meanings.sent2: The library had a collection of offprints from various academic journals.
meanings.sent3: The offprint of the recipe was so tiny, it looked like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an offprint of happiness on her face.
meanings.sent5: The offprint of the map made it easier to read the details.

meanings.definition: To print a separate copy of an article or chapter that originally appeared as part of a larger publication.
meanings.sent1: She decided to offprint the research paper for her presentation.
meanings.sent2: The publisher agreed to offprint the popular chapter as a standalone booklet.
meanings.sent3: He offprinted the document in color to make it stand out.
meanings.sent4: The idea offprinted in his mind, and he couldn't shake it off.
meanings.sent5: The printer offprinted the manuscript with precision and care.
